messages.message:
Hi team,
I was recently working on creating infrastructure for central observability and during that I faced difficulties with destroying terraform module pointing to importance of controller dependencies in terraform. I compiled my finds in this case study (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/x/GQABjw) doc explaining what happened, root cause and how we can prevent these errors in the future!
Thanks!

PS: The guide contains some intrinsic details around AWS concepts and terraform which can be a bit obscure to some folks, I tried to cover the scenerio in details, please feel free to reach out to me for any question (and also suggestion how to make the case study better :smile:)
cc @HH @abhitaker @sudeep

The importance of controller dependencies came up again during <#C07FDRH24JC|>, where due to some other reason controller were not active and hence resources were not getting deleted make the stack go in inconsistent state. Refer this (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C07FDRH24JC/p1722424230776459) thread for more details.
